text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition Operation-Device

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slices for extension Content/Rules for all slices
extension:status 1..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"status"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/device-operationstatus (example): The operational status of the device.

extension:statusReason 0..*ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"statusReason"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/device-operation-status-reason (example): The availability status reason of the device.

extension:operator 0..*ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"operator"
value[x] 0..1Reference(PT_Patient | PT_Practitioner | PT_RelatedPerson)Value of extension
extension:mode 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"mode"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: device-operation-mode (example): The operation mode of the device.

extension:cycle 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"cycle"
value[x] 0..1CountValue of extension
extension:duration 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"duration"
value[x] 0..1DurationValue of extension
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.pt/fhir/core/StructureDefinition/Operation-Device"
value[x] 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: Operation
description: The status of the device itself - whether it is switched on, or activated, etc. - Extension created based on what exists in FHIR Version 5

element.definition: The status of the device itself - whether it is switched on, or activated, etc. - Extension created based on what exists in FHIR Version 5

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).
